function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Idiosyncratic events within a country, such as holidays or backlog in testing laboratories, could generate nonuniform country-wide changes in infection growth for individual days.","Impact":"Increases the risk of unpredictable and nonuniform spread of infections within a country, potentially leading to higher transmission rates.","Mitigation":"Implement standardized testing and reporting procedures across different regions within a country to minimize the impact of idiosyncratic events on infection growth.","Technologies":"Standardized reporting systems, real-time data sharing and analysis platforms.","People":"Public health authorities, policymakers, and healthcare providers.","Owner":"Public health authorities, policymakers, and healthcare providers."},{"Description":"Systematic underreporting of infections is a major concern in the ongoing pandemic, which can lead to inaccurate estimates of the true infection rate.","Impact":"Underreporting of infections can result in inadequate resource allocation, ineffective policies, and inaccurate assessment of the pandemic situation.","Mitigation":"Develop and implement robust reporting mechanisms, increase testing capacity, and use statistical methods to adjust for underreporting.","Technologies":"Data analytics, statistical modeling, surveillance systems, and testing infrastructure.","People":"Public health agencies, government authorities, and epidemiologists.","Owner":"Public health agencies, government authorities, and epidemiologists."}]}
